page.title: 09CATTLE & CROPS
page.content: {Cattle}raising is also very important in the{Grosmont}area but not every farm nowadays keeps a milking herd. Most of the cattle are reared for beef but a large number are sold as calves. These are mainly{Herefords}or{Hereford {Charolais Crosses}which are very good for beef. One of our farms rears bulls to sell. The milk that is produced in this area is mainly sold to{Cadburys for making into dairy milk chocolate. Growing cereals and other crops is not so important as it was in the {Middle Ages,}because conditions are more suitable for livestock.In the valley of the{River Monnow,}however, where the land is flatter and less than 100m above sea level,wheat and barley are the most popular crops. Very few potatoes or root crops are grown.
